columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: The Community ID (CID) of the instance that owns this contact. This is only populated if you use IntraConnect.

columns.name: TXP_ELIGIBILITY_C_NAME
columns.description: Transplant waitlist eligibility criteria for committee review.
entries: Life expectancy without transplant < life expectancy with transplant
Demonstration of the ability to comply with the post-transplant regimen
Congenital heart disease not amenable to repair
Failure of standard medical-surgical therapy to reverse the cardiac failure
Creatinine clearance < 20cc per minute or uremic symptoms
Doumented chronic renal failure of at least 6-8 weeks duration with etiology unknown
If HIV positive, CD4 > or = 200 and clinical clearance
Irreversible renal failure defined as GFR < 20cc/minute/1.73m2
Pediatrics only - weight > or = 10 kg and length > or = 80 cm
Idiopathic or cryptogenic CAH or cirrhosis
Maximal medical/surgical therapy has been exhausted and is no longer effective
Metabolic liver disease: Ornithine transcarbarmylase deficiency
Primary hepatocellular carcinoma if no viable tumor, status post-treatment
Primary hepatocellular carcinoma if tumor meets size criteria
Primary hepatocellular carcinoma if no macrovascular involvement
Primary hepatocellular carcinoma if no identifiable extrahepatic spread of tumor
Primary hepatocellular carcinoma if not a candidate for subtotal liver resection
End-stage hepatic disease is present or rapidly inevitable
Past total pancreatectomy for benign conditions
Diabetic complications inc diab retinopathy, neuropathy, gastropathy, vasculopathy
Type I Diabetes: Brittle control of blood sugar, fluctuations of high and low
Type I Diabetes: C-Peptide level < or = 0.5
Type I Diab: Creat clear >or = 40 mg/dl w calcineurin inhibitors & protein urea < 1gm
Type I Diabetes: Evidence of poor glucose control
Type I Diabetes: Recurring severe ketoacidosis
Type I Diabetes: Secondary diabetic complications
Type I Diabetes: Stable kidney transplant function
Type II Diabetes: C-Peptide level < or = 0.5
Type II Diabetes: Creatinine clearance > or = 60 mg/dl and protein urea < 1 gm
Type II Diabetes: Evidence of poor glucose control
Type II Diabetes: History of insulin dependency with severe complications
Type II Diabetes: Intensive management by endocrinology for at least 12 months
